title: Install from source error on Ubuntu 14.04
body_html:
Install command:

$ git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch 
$ export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/home/jelly/anaconda2
$ conda install numpy mkl setuptools cmake gcc cffi
$ conda install -c soumith magma-cuda75
$ pip install -r requirements.txt
$ python setup.py install

Error message:

error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1
cc1plus: warning: command line option ‘-Wstrict-prototypes’ is valid for C/ObjC but not for C++ [enabled by default]
Exception in thread Thread-8 (most likely raised during interpreter shutdown):
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 801, in __bootstrap_inner
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 754, in run
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 113, in worker
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 65, in mapstar
  File "setup.py", line 44, in _single_compile
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/unixccompiler.py", line 122, in _compile
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/ccompiler.py", line 876, in spawn
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/spawn.py", line 38, in spawn
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/spawn.py", line 176, in _spawn_posix

gcc version

gcc (GCC) 4.8.5

python version

Python 2.7.12 :: Anaconda custom (64-bit)

Install command:
$ git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch 
$ export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/home/jelly/anaconda2
$ conda install numpy mkl setuptools cmake gcc cffi
$ conda install -c soumith magma-cuda75
$ pip install -r requirements.txt
$ python setup.py install

Error message:
error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1

body:
## Install command:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch 
$ export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/home/jelly/anaconda2
$ conda install numpy mkl setuptools cmake gcc cffi
$ conda install -c soumith magma-cuda75
$ pip install -r requirements.txt
$ python setup.py install
```
## Error message:
```
error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1
cc1plus: warning: command line option ‘-Wstrict-prototypes’ is valid for C/ObjC but not for C++ [enabled by default]
Exception in thread Thread-8 (most likely raised during interpreter shutdown):
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 801, in __bootstrap_inner
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 754, in run
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 113, in worker
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 65, in mapstar
  File "setup.py", line 44, in _single_compile
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/unixccompiler.py", line 122, in _compile
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/ccompiler.py", line 876, in spawn
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/spawn.py", line 38, in spawn
  File "/home/jelly/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/distutils/spawn.py", line 176, in _spawn_posix
```
### gcc version
gcc (GCC) 4.8.5

### python version
Python 2.7.12 :: Anaconda custom (64-bit)
